title: Remove wallpaper UI and fully disable wallpaper feature

requirements.summary: Remove the "Background wallpaper" control from the header so users cannot access wallpaper selection/removal UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The header no longer renders the WallpaperSettingsDialog trigger/button.
No UI in the app shows the text "Background wallpaper" or offers wallpaper selection/removal.

file_operations.description: Remove the WallpaperSettingsDialog import and its render so the header no longer exposes any wallpaper control (and no longer displays the text "Background wallpaper").

requirements.summary: Disable wallpaper application/rendering across the app and clear any previously persisted wallpaper from localStorage on load.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer renders the wallpaper background layers (e.g., the elements using the app-wallpaper/app-wallpaper-overlay styling) even if a prior wallpaper exists in localStorage.
On load, any value stored under the wallpaper storage key is removed so wallpapers do not persist across sessions.

file_operations.description: Remove useWallpaper usage and remove the wallpaper background layer rendering (app-wallpaper/app-wallpaper-overlay). Add a lightweight on-mount cleanup that removes the existing wallpaper localStorage key so previously persisted wallpapers never reappear.

requirements.summary: Remove unused wallpaper-related components/hooks/styles after disabling the feature to avoid dead code and unused selectors.
acceptanceCriteria: The project builds without unused-import errors related to wallpaper code.
Wallpaper-specific CSS (e.g., app wallpaper background selectors) is removed if no longer referenced anywhere.

file_operations.description: Delete the wallpaper settings dialog component since the wallpaper feature and its UI are being removed.
Delete the wallpaper hook that managed persisted wallpaper state, since wallpaper is no longer supported.
Delete wallpaper validation utilities that were only used by the wallpaper dialog.

Remove wallpaper-specific CSS selectors (e.g., .app-wallpaper, .app-wallpaper-overlay and any wallpaper-only rules). Keep non-wallpaper layout styling (e.g., app-container/app-content) as needed for the app layout.
